View_Interfaces

Interface IFileChooser

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDialog, IView, java.util.Observer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileChooser

    public interface IFileChooser
extends IDialog
    Classes implementing this interface provide a simple mechanism to let the user choose a file. To simplify the progress of selecting a file this interface builds up a standard structure for GUI managing this including an API for usage (see below).

    Usage
    Due to the fact that choosing a file is a progress which should run in front of all other views this view has to be a IDialog.
    To get the selected file after processing, the method getChosenFilePath() will return the absolute path of the file chosen by the user. If the user has not chosen a file the null value is returned.
    To provide different layouts for the reason of choosing a file the parameter FileAccessType in Creating is for selecting between open, save, import and export. Caution
    By making the view visible by calling IView.showView() the current thread will be blocked until the user closes the view, cancels or chooses a file! This is done to simplify the usage of such file chooser by a controller, because the program mostly stops until the user has chosen a file. If the thread should not be blocked start this function in a new Thread.

    API:
    //Assuming: "myFileChooser" is object of IFileChooser
    myFileChooser.showView(); //Blocks execution
    String filePath = myFileChooser.getChosenFilePath(); //Gets absolute path to chosen file

    View actions in view
    This view holds an internal controller so that no view actions are needed to be controlled.

    Creating
    For creating a IFileChooser please refer to IViewFacadeFactory.createFileChooser(IView, FileAccessType).

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    9045534
    See Also:
    IDialog, IViewFacadeFactory.createFileChooser(IView, FileAccessType), FileAccessType

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getChosenFilePath()
      Returns the file chosen by the user.

      • Methods inherited from interface View_Interfaces.IView

        addController, bringToFront, destruct, getViewMenu, showView

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.Observer

        update

    • Method Detail

      • getChosenFilePath

        java.lang.String getChosenFilePath()
        Returns the file chosen by the user. If the user canceled or closed the window null will be returned.
        Returns:
        Absolute file path chosen by user. If no file chosen null is returned.
